thread.title: ‘Get a jacket!’: Dasha’s fashion faux pas
thread.title_full: ‘Get a jacket!’: Dasha’s fashion faux pas

title: ‘Get a jacket!’: Dasha’s fashion faux pas
text:
Australian Open Confidential: Daria Gavrilova and Timea Bacsinszky in same outfit, ball kid collected by Bautista Agut Staff writers, FOX SPORTS January 22, 2017 11:30am 
IT seems there are no clash guernseys in tennis. 
With most of the major stars in the sport sponsored by one major athletics brand or another, it appears there is often a lack of outfit options. 
That was clear on Saturday night when Australian 22nd seed Daria Gavrilova and Swiss 12th seed Timea Bacsinszky walked out onto Rod Laver Arena looking nearly identical. 
Both women were in the same navy blue top with a light blue skirt and white headgear — although Dasha wore a visor and Bacsinszky opted for a headband. But even their shoes, and shoelaces, were the same. media_camera Australia's Daria Gavrilova is congratulated by Switzerland's Timea Bacsinszky. Even the photographer believed Dasha was on the left and not the right in this photo — no joke. 
While this may seem a bit light for some, it was an issue for many viewers who couldn’t at a glance tell which player was which. 
The hilarious fashion faux pas reminded many fans on social media of the recent Channel Nine incident wherein a journalist was upset at another for wearing the same colour and not putting on a jacket. 
But what made it even more strange was that this wasn’t the first time Gavrilova has had the same problem. 
Earlier this January at the Hopman Cup, Gavrilova defeated American Coco Vandeweghe — with both women wearing the same two-toned blue outfit. media_camera Hopman Cup 2017 — Dasha returns to... media_camera ...Vandeweghe. We think. (Photos by Paul Kane/Getty Images) 
And the year before that at the same event, Gavrilova and opponent Sabine Lisicki were also hard to split. It wasn’t the same outfit — they were wearing two different brands — but you could’ve fooled most people. media_camera Hopman Cup 2016 — Sabine Lisicki returns a serve from... media_camera ...her mirror mode opponent, Dasha. (Photos: Daniel Wilkins) 
There are probably other, more important things for the tennis higher-ups to deal with most days. But we’re just saying — it’s a bit odd. 
...AND I GET UP AGAIN 
TENNIS isn’t usually a contact sport — particularly for non-participants. 
But a ball kid found out the hard way that sometimes it is during the all-Spanish clash between 13th seed Roberto Bautista Agut and 21st seed David Ferrer on Saturday. 
Bautista Agut went all out for a ball and ended up storming towards the umpires’ chair — so quickly that the ball kid standing next to it didn’t have time to get out of the way. Ball kid cops huge hit 0:34 
Australian Open: Bautista Agut takes out a ball boy in epic style at the Australian Open January 21st 2017 /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Tennis/ Ball kid cops huge hit 
Thankfully the kid wasn’t hurt — if anything, Bautista Agut seemed to get the worse of the hit as he was left with a bit of a headache.
